When you create a processing account, we send a copy of the pricing agreement to the merchant to sign. You can choose to send them a copy of the pricing agreement by email, or you can generate a link to the pricing agreement.
If you requested the merchant's signature by email and they don't respond, use our Reminders endpoint to create a reminder and to send another email.
**Note:** You can use the Reminders endpoint only if you request the merchant's signature by email. If you generate a link to the pricing agreement, you can't use the Reminders endpoint.
(Required) Unique identifier of the processing account.

response.name: Successful request. We sent the email to the merchant.

item.name: Payment instructions
item.description: Submit instructions for initiating payments on physical devices running semi-integrated apps.

description.content: Submit an instruction request to initiate a sale on a payment device.
(Required) Serial number that identifies the merchant’s payment device.

(Required) The idempotency key that is supplied as part of every POST request MUST be unique and MUST not be reused with another request with a different request payload. The value should be UUID v4 (RFC4122)

response.name: Successful request. We accepted the payment instruction to process.

item.name: Bank transfer refunds
item.description: Return payments to customers' bank accounts.

description.content:
Send a refund to a customer's bank account. The refund transaction is not linked to the previous transaction.  
*Note**: This function is available to only certain merchant accounts.

(Required) The idempotency key that is supplied as part of every POST request MUST be unique and MUST not be reused with another request with a different request payload. The value should be UUID v4 (RFC4122)

response.name: Successful request. We sent the refund to the customer's bank account.

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.name: Currency conversion
item.description: Offer dynamic currency conversion to customers.

description.content:
Check if a customer’s card is eligible for Dynamic Currency Conversion (DCC).
If the card is eligible for DCC, offer currency conversion to the customer during a transaction.  
**Note:** We offer this through the DCC service, which gives customers a choice to pay in the local currency or their own currency.

response.name: Successful request. Returns the currency conversion rate for the transaction.

List subscriptions linked to a terminal.  
To filter your results, use the query parameters.
Filter by the customer's name.
Filter by the last four digits of the card or account number.
Filter by the name of the payment plan.
Filter by the frequency of subscription payments.
Filter by the current status of the subscription.

Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`  
Filter subscriptions that end on a specific date.

Format: `YYYY-MM-DD`  
Filter subscriptions by the date that the next payment is collected.
Points to the resource identifier that you want to receive your results before. Typically, this is the first resource on the previous page.
Points to the resource identifier that you want to receive your results after. Typically, this is the last resource on the previous page.
States the total amount of results the response is limited to.

(Required) The idempotency key that is supplied as part of every POST request MUST be unique and MUST not be reused with another request with a different request payload. The value should be UUID v4 (RFC4122)
